intro: Kerneria bipinnata, commonly known as the double-pinnate kerneria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its bipinnate leaves, which are finely divided and give it a feathery appearance. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pale yellow or cream in color. Kerneria bipinnata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
